00023 /*
00024   \file RowSource - Band source implementation for data produced in rows
00025 
00026   The RowSource object is derived from the DataSource object and is used for
00027   algorithms that generate data in rows. The RowSource object provides a
00028   wrapper to integrate a row oriented algorithm into the Writer source model.
00029 
00030   An example is the generation of the magnitude of a complex function. If the
00031   intended input image is very large and memory constraints prevent reading
00032   the entire image into memory, this simple algorithm could be implemented by
00033   reading the input in groups of full rows (strips), transforming each strip
00034   and then writing the rows to the output file.
00035 
00036   The algorithm must be organized into an object that allows generation of
00037   individual rows. In the example, the algorthm object would have to have a
00038   a setup function that initializes whatever state is required to begin
00039   processing rows. A "nextRow" method is required as well as a clean-up
00040   function. The "nextRow" function specifies the band and the algorithm
00041   object and must be able to provide the row data one band at a time. The
00042   caller is responsible for the making the set-up and clean-up calls and the
00043   object must handle input processing. The object may make the following two
00044   assumptions (only):
00045 
00046        Requests to the object are sequential, no seeks
00047        Requests to the object are in units of whole rows
00048        Bands from the same image source are read in parallel
00049 
00050 */
00051 
00052 #ifndef __NITF_ROW_SOURCE_H__
00053 #define __NITF_ROW_SOURCE_H__
00054 
00055 #include "nitf/BandSource.h"
00056 
00057 NITF_CXX_GUARD
00058 
00069 typedef NITF_BOOL(*NITF_ROW_SOURCE_NEXT_ROW) (void *algorithm,
00070         nitf_Uint32 band,
00071         NITF_DATA * buffer,
00072         nitf_Error * error);
00073 
00074 /*
00075   \brief nitf_RowSource_construct - Constructor for the RowSource object
00076 
00077   The constructor for the row source object. This object maintains state
00078   information and cannot be reused for a second write.
00079 
00080   \return The new object or NULL on error. On error, the error object is
00081   set
00082 */
00083 NITFAPI(nitf_BandSource *) nitf_RowSource_construct
00084 (
00085     void *algorithm,                    
00086     NITF_ROW_SOURCE_NEXT_ROW nextRow,   
00087     nitf_Uint32 band,                   
00088     nitf_Uint32 numRows,                
00089     nitf_Uint32 rowLength,              
00090     nitf_Error * error                  
00091 );
00092 
00093 NITF_CXX_ENDGUARD
00094 #endif
